---
title: "Overview"
---

## High-level description
This code defines a simple API package with a single function `PrintHello()`. The function's purpose is to print the string "hello" to the console.

## Symbols

### `PrintHello`
#### Description
`PrintHello` is a function that prints the string "hello" to the standard output. It uses the `fmt.Println` function from the Go standard library to accomplish this task.

#### Inputs
This function does not take any inputs.

#### Outputs
This function does not return any values. However, it has a side effect of printing to the console.

#### Internal Logic
The function simply calls `fmt.Println("hello")`, which prints the string "hello" followed by a newline character to the standard output.

## Side Effects
The `PrintHello` function has the side effect of printing to the console, which modifies the state of the standard output stream.

## Dependencies
| Dependency | Purpose |
|:-----------|:--------|
| fmt | Used for printing to the console |

The code imports the `fmt` package from the Go standard library, which provides formatting and printing functionality.
